Text.Value: Then maybe you have a chance to redeem yourself.
Then I shall make things simple. You stole our little ones from us - can you steal them back from your master?
Then we would choose revenge. We would see Cazador Szarr's legacy burned to nothing, and all vampires driven from Baldur's Gate.
All but you. Do this for us and we will leave you alone.
The last time you came to our camp, you stole our children. Our future.
Hello again, my erstwhile quarry. I did not think to see you here of all places.
Im orak ne tay. Krasin ne trah!

EditorData.NodeContext: IM or-AK nay tay. KRAS-in nay TRAH

Text.Value: Ah, that is... complicated.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Ulma pauses for a moment, staring at the fire in contemplation before she turns and walks over to the player.

Text.Value: I know. I remember your friend from the swamp.
Forget it, I'm not sacrificing myself for your cause.
Yes, I remember your hunter from the swamp. It didn't end well for him.

EditorData.NodeContext: Referring to a hunter you killed.

Text.Value: We offer you a chance, perhaps your final chance, to heal just some of the pain you have caused.
Yes, it's true.
I looked for you high and low, across mountain and swamp. You were an elusive quarry indeed.
We know you as an evil man.
*You've clearly walked into some kind of ceremony, but it's nothing that you recognise.*
When I was hunting you, I was to bring you back here. To interrogate you, discover how to save our children, and then destroy you.
And here I am. What do you want?
*You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - the same monster hunters you met in the hag's swamp. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*
Rech té i hathran roost.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing,

Text.Value: Choose your words carefully, spawn. I would happily see you burn for your sins.
I'll do what I can for them, I promise.

EditorData.stateContext: Ulma standing, talking to players in normal positioning
Ulma is standing in front of a burning pyre, arms raised, reciting funeral rites for fallen soldiers

Text.Value: Attack her.
All right, I'll do what I can.
Then we can all see what you really are. At best, a coward. At worst, a monster.
I - if I can help them, I will. But you have to understand that Cazador is merciless. There's every chance they're already dead.
It matters because you are the last hope to rescue our little ones from Cazador Szarr.
Then we have no use for you. And you must pay for your sins.
Frey vald isk durovna. Frey vald isk ablast.

EditorData.NodeContext: FREY vald isk dur-OF-nah. FREY vald isk ab-LAST

Text.Value: *You recognise the funeral rites of the Gur people - a tribe of monster hunters you've had dealings with before. Their leader is burning the possessions of those who have fallen.*
When we sent Gandrel after you, we wanted to interrogate you. To discover how to save our children and then destroy you.
Please, go. Time is short, but we will see you again when it is done.
A monster indeed. Hunters, to me!
Yes, I remember your friend. And how he was left trudging around a swamp.
And if they're already dead?
Here I am. Now what do you want?

EditorData.NodeContext: responding to "I'd love nothing more than to throw you onto that fire"

Text.Value: He will throw his doors open to you, lower his defences, and you will save the children you damned.
Is it true you left your master? That you broke the spell that binds you to him?
Really? You should have tried looking harder.
Somewhat. It's... complicated.
But you - you are someone he wants. Someone he thinks he can control, but with powers beyond his imagining.
*You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters you've had dealings with before.*
So, the impossible spawn walks among us in the blazing sun. We have been looking for you.
What does it matter to you?
I noticed. It didn't end well for the hunter I met in the swamp.
But it will be a start. You may still be redeemed.
You have lived a life of violence and sin. You have stolen lives, broken families, and caused immeasurable grief.  Doing this will not right those wrongs.
You would be wise not to dredge up the past, spawn.
So, tell us - who are you? Someone worthy of redemption or the monster the world believes you to be?
If you want a fight, you're going to need a bigger funeral pyre.
You think you can guilt me into doing what you're too weak to?
I have nothing to say to you or your people.
But things have changed. You have changed.
And if I decline to help?
We have tried to save our children once already, attacking the vampire's palace at first light. Even then, it was too well defended.
*You do recognise the language, however. These people are Gur, a tribe of monster hunters just like the one you met in the hag's swamp.*
Rech té i hathran roost.

EditorData.CinematicNodeContext: Looking onto a pyre, where a variety of possessions are being burned - armour and broken weapons, as well as clothing,

Synopsis:
Ulma, the leader of Gur Tribe, talks to Astarion-avatar. Gur Hunter from Act 1, if he is alive, also present.
